extendedIngredients.name: maple syrup
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 to 4 teaspoons maple syrup, to taste (I like 3 teaspoons, which is the equivalent of ½ ounce or 1 tablespoon)
metaInformation: (I like 3 teaspoons, which is the equivalent of ½ ounce or 1 tablespoon)

extendedIngredients.name: red wine
extendedIngredients.originalString: ½ ounce (1 tablespoon) fruity red wine*

extendedIngredients.name: whiskey
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 ounces (1/4 cup) rye whiskey or bourbon (I like Rieger's brand—a local Kansas City distillery—and Bulleit)
metaInformation: (I like Rieger's brand—a local Kansas City distillery—and Bulleit)

recipes.title: Maple New York Sour
recipes.instructions: Fill a cocktail shaker or mason jar about two-thirds full with ice. Pour in the whiskey, lemon juice and maple syrup. Securely fasten the lid and shake for about 30 seconds.Pour fresh ice into your cocktail glass. Strain the cold whiskey sour mixture into the glass. Slowly pour the wine over the back of a spoon held just above the drinks surface, so it has a nice layered effect. Sip up!

steps.step: Fill a cocktail shaker or mason jar about two-thirds full with ice.
Pour in the whiskey, lemon juice and maple syrup. Securely fasten the lid and shake for about 30 seconds.

Pour fresh ice into your cocktail glass. Strain the cold whiskey sour mixture into the glass. Slowly pour the wine over the back of a spoon held just above the drinks surface, so it has a nice layered effect. Sip up!
